intro: Astrochlaena rotundata, commonly known as the roundleaf astrochlaena, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its round, fleshy leaves and showy, often pink or red flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is known for its ornamental value. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
